sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Remotely Hosted HTA File Executed Via Mshta.EXE
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects execution of the "mshta" utility with an argument containing the "http" keyword, which could indicate that an attacker is executing a remotely hosted malicious hta file

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Processes Spawning Suspicious Programs
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious child processes of a Windows shell and scripting processes such as wscript, rundll32, powershell, mshta...etc.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the execution of "forfiles" with the "/c" flag.
While this is an expected behavior of the tool, it can be abused in order to proxy execution through it with any binary.
Can be used to bypass application whitelisting.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Tim Rauch, Elastic, E.M. Anhaus (originally from Atomic Blue Detections, Endgame), oscd.community

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.
